intro: Xyris mexiae, commonly known as Mexican yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the genus Xyris in the family Xyridaceae, which includes several species of grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or scrub habitats. Xyris mexiae is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
